worklogs.comment:
github-actions[bot] commented on PR #14125:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14125#issuecomment-1247102816

   :warning: Ticket **has not been started in JIRA**, please click 'Start Progress'.

js8544 commented on PR #14125:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14125#issuecomment-1247186236

   There is another problem now: LLVM 15 adds dependency on zstd. It looks for target `zstd::libzstd_shared`, but arrow prefers `zstd::libzstd`. Let me try to turn of LLVM_ENABLE_ZSTD and see if it works.

kou commented on PR #14125:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14125#issuecomment-1247415127

   It seems that the Zstd's official CMake package uses `zstd::libzstd_shared` and `zstd::libzstd_static`.
   So our CMake configurations should follow it. (And our `Findzstd.cmake` should support the Zstd's official CMake package too.)
   
   I'll push a change for it to this branch later. Please wait for a while...

pitrou commented on PR #14125:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14125#issuecomment-1247728818

   > There is another problem now: LLVM 15 adds dependency on zstd
   
   Is it a mandatory dependency? zstd shouldn't be required to write a JIT...

js8544 commented on PR #14125:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14125#issuecomment-1247936703

   > > There is another problem now: LLVM 15 adds dependency on zstd
   > 
   > Is it a mandatory dependency? zstd shouldn't be required to write a JIT...
   
   The dependency can be avoided by turning LLVM_ENABLE_ZSTD off. But I'm a CMake newbie and not sure how to do it properly...

pitrou commented on PR #14125:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14125#issuecomment-1247938487

   Most probably, we must also accomodate for the fact that pre-built binary packages for LLVM probably have zstd enabled anyway.

kou commented on PR #14125:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14125#issuecomment-1249103072

   It seems that Gandiva with LLVM 15 have problems at least on MinGW.
   But I'm not sure it's caused only on MinGW or can be caused on other platforms.
   It's difficult to debug this on MinGW. So I propose that we merge this by disabling Gandiva related tests or Gandiva support only on MinGW for now. We can fix the problem when other platforms provide LLVM 15 and the same problem is occurred on these platforms.

pitrou commented on PR #14125:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14125#issuecomment-1249105186

   > It's difficult to debug this on MinGW. So I propose that we merge this by disabling Gandiva related tests or Gandiva support only on MinGW for now. We can fix the problem when other platforms provide LLVM 15 and the same problem is occurred on these platforms.
   
   That is fine with me.

kou commented on PR #14125:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14125#issuecomment-1249772397

   "R / rhub/debian-gcc-devel:latest" is failed:
   
   https://github.com/apache/arrow/actions/runs/3063524875/jobs/4951928558#step:5:27585
   
   ```text
   ══ Failed tests ════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
   ── Error (test-duckdb.R:212:3): Joining, auto-cleanup enabled ──────────────────
   Error: rapi_execute: Failed to run query
   Error: Invalid Error: std::exception
   Backtrace:
       ▆
    1. ├─DBI::dbGetQuery(...) at test-duckdb.R:212:2
    2. └─DBI::dbGetQuery(...)
    3.   └─DBI (local) .local(conn, statement, ...)
    4.     ├─DBI::dbSendQuery(conn, statement, ...)
    5.     └─duckdb::dbSendQuery(conn, statement, ...)
    6.       └─duckdb (local) .local(conn, statement, ...)
    7.         └─duckdb:::duckdb_result(...)
    8.           └─duckdb:::duckdb_execute(res)
    9.             └─duckdb:::rapi_execute(...)
   
   [ FAIL 1 | WARN 0 | SKIP 28 | PASS 8467 ]
   ```
   
   ("AMD64 Ubuntu 20.04 R 4.2 Force-Tests true" has the same failure.)
   
   But this will be solved by #14149. So I merge this.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
The MinGW C++ builds have started failing very recently with (seemingly) unrelated CMake configuration failures. Example:
https://github.com/apache/arrow/actions/runs/3052791203/jobs/4922591671

This is happened MSYS2 provides LLVM 15 and Apache Arrow C++ doesn't accept LLVM 15 yet.

comments.body: I think it's because MSYS2 updated its LLVM version to 15.0.0 a few days ago [https://github.com/msys2/MINGW-packages/commit/babbba3822e209de5dc3faec5a38f9f3dda8a266|https://github.com/msys2/MINGW-packages/commit/babbba3822e209de5dc3faec5a38f9f3dda8a266] and arrow doesn't accept LLVM 15 yet. I'll submit a PR to fix this.
Right. We need to add support for LLVM 15 like ARROW-16105, ARROW-14364 and so on.
